data.title: Real Grade Epyon
data.body: This kit felt great to build, not too difficult and came out looking great. The transformation is simple and doesn't compromise the rest of the model kit like the RG Zeta Gundam. The kit looks slightly different from the anime, but the changes look good (little dragon mouths on the feet that can open when in flight mode, slightly different wings, etc.) Great color separation too. The heat whip of the kit also comes as one pre-molded piece which makes it so that you don't have to tediously assemble each section of the whip, makes the whip feel stronger, and easy to set in dynamic poses by rotating pieces of the whip. Accessory-wise the kit only comes with a beam saber, shield, and heat whip; but that's because the Epyon didn't really use anything else so it wouldn't make sense to include a rifle or other handheld weapon. Comes with a large sticker sheet for adding additional superfluous details, although the piece for the eyes is color correct which allows you to skip applying those annoying eye stickers if you choose which is a nice bonus.

data.title: Absolute peak of gunpla design
data.body: RG Epyon is beyond any doubt a top of the line gunpla kit. Aesthetically, color separation is on point, it's overall looks are simply fantastic and has some of the best light piping yet in gunpla. The build its also a lot of fun, though some small pieces may be a little tough to deal with for beginners. Articulation is great, not only is it highly posable but the build is sturdy as a rock. Just a great kill all around.

This kit is so much fun to build. It’s got so many fun gimmicks. The stickers included with the kit are minimal, and they really don’t look bad at all. Waterslide decals would likely look better, but the sticker decals look perfectly fine, in my opinion. The finished product is gorgeous and you’ll love it if you buy it. It’s super pose-able. Doesn’t require a stand to display. Even the wings are poseable. This kit is amazing.

data.title: Yet another amazing RG.
data.body: If you're familiar with modern RG kits, you know what to expect here. Amazing color separation. Brilliant engineering and articulation. Solid and extremely enjoyable construction. And as silly as I find the Mobile Armor mode, (two headed dragon mode) it's a simple and effective transformation. It's a must buy in my opinion. Just watch the price and wait for it to normalize, though. New Gunpla tends to be a bit pricey on Amazon.

data.title: Very good quality
data.body: Each piece was very detailed and in good condition. Good gift for a great price!

data.title: It has a lot of detail, not well balanced you would need to buy a stand
data.body: It’s a really detailed and complete model kit, it looks amazing and was a lot of flexibility and features that make it awesome, really cheap for the quality, but it doesn’t have balance, just as how you put wings on the figure would not be able to stand up straight, a really expensive stand(in case you want the original one) would really be needed if you want more dynamic poses.

data.title: Worth every penny
data.body: Amazing model kit. Spent a good couple of hours and amazing experience.

data.title: Fast shipping
data.body: Was deleverage quickly and in good shape haven’t built it yet but I’ve herd good things

data.title: I LOVE TOYS
data.body: I can’t stop playing with my toys I love my toys

data.title: Cheapest price in ANY market
data.body: Since this kit is recent, released around september of last year, it retails for around $54 to $70. Didn't expect Amazon to have it on sale for below $50. Arrived earlier than expected, but there were a few creases on the box, but the runners were completely fine.

data.title: It was a gift
data.body: He seemed to think it was just what he wanted

data.title: Given as a gift, Recipient was thrilled
data.body: As the title says, it was a gift. He was very pleased with the product and I received it in good condition, though there was a slight crease on the box from shipping. I'd remove half a star for that if I could, but recipient said it wasn't a big deal for him so I'll keep it at five star.

data.title: Cool Model
data.body: I’m giving it 5 stars because my adult son wants it for Christmas. He received one last year too so I’m assuming it’s a “big deal”. I’m thankful that it came almost in perfect shape with just a slight worn spot on one corner of the box. It was...Delivered in a sack rather than boxed.

data.title: A nice model kit to build a good buy for the price
data.body:
I liked this model kit
It goes to together well nice size
Good Appearance nice value for your money
The only big issue I have is I received my damaged before I even opened it up
It's a nice model kit
My only WARNING ⚠️ be careful which seller you buy this from
Very poor with the seller and shipping

I'd buy this again but probably from a better more dependable seller

The model kit was good not mest up to much
Because of bad shipping
But the model I'd give 4 out of 5 seller not so much
But this is a very good buy size is good to nice model to build definitely
